story:
Once upon a time, in the beautiful country of Afghanistan, there lived a young girl named Sara. Sara had the most enchanting black eyes that sparkled like the stars in the night sky, and a heart as kind as the gentle spring breeze.

Every night before bedtime, Sara's father would tuck her into bed and tell her a magical story. He would whisper tales of brave warriors and wise princesses, of dragons roaming the mountains and fairies dancing in the gardens.

One night, as Sara gazed up at her father with wide eyes full of wonder, he began to tell her a special story about a magical garden hidden in the heart of the mountains. In this garden, the flowers bloomed in every color of the rainbow, and the trees whispered secrets of ancient times.

Sara listened intently as her father painted a vivid picture of the garden, describing the shimmering pond where golden fish swam gracefully and the butterflies danced among the fragrant blossoms.

As her father's voice grew softer and the night grew darker, Sara felt a sense of peace and contentment wash over her. She closed her eyes and drifted off into a deep and restful sleep, dreaming of the magical garden and all the wonders that awaited her there.

And so, in that peaceful moment between wakefulness and slumber, Sara knew that she was safe and loved, surrounded by the warmth of her father's stories and the endless possibilities of her dreams.

The end. Goodnight, sweet Sara. May your dreams be as magical as the stories your father tells you.
